Haunted Zone.name: Haunted Zone
Haunted Zone.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=xmF8v1o2HyVyepb6]], any [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=xmF8v1o2HyVyepb6]] [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=xmF8v1o2HyVyepb6]] while inside the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space.

Failure: The spell fails and is wasted.

Undead Restoration.name: Undead Restoration
Undead Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it revives 24 hours later unless @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good} is cast on its remains. If it revives, it animates another Gargantuan object or structure elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmObjectSlam0000]] attacks and uses [[/item .mmInvitation0000]] Invitation.

Object Slam.name: Object Slam
Object Slam.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]] (with Advantage if the target is inside the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space), reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. or range [[lookup @item.range.value]]/[[lookup @item.range.long]] ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Invitation.name: Invitation
Invitation.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC 17, each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=dmDueJBxvNHlrRhx]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dmDueJBxvNHlrRhx]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target is teleported inside the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space and swallowed. A swallowed [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=dmDueJBxvNHlrRhx]] has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Hit Points, a swallowed [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=dmDueJBxvNHlrRhx]] can leave the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the Plane Shift spell.

Total Cover.name: Total Cover
Total Cover.description: A swallowed creature has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the revenant.

Ancient Deep Dragon.name: Ancient Deep Dragon
Ancient Deep Dragon.description:
Deep Dragon Lairs

Deep dragons lair in fungus-encrusted caverns of the Underdark or old, forgotten ruins, preferring locations near subterranean bodies of water.

The region containing an adult or ancient deep dragon’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Preservation of Knowledge. Books and other written forms of communication with 1 mile of the lair become magically protected and can’t be damaged by nonmagical means.

Restless Sleep. When a creature finishes a Long Rest within 1 mile of the lair, the creature makes a [[/save con 10 format=long]]. On a failed save, the creature doesn’t reduce its Exhaustion level as a result of finishing that Long Rest. Creatures with Immunity to the Poisoned condition are immune to this effect.

Verdant Growth. Vegetation and fungi within 1 mile of the dragon’s lair grow faster and cover a greater area than normal. Foraging in this area yields twice the usual amount of food. The dragon is immediately aware of the presence of any creature that eats this enhanced vegetation.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dragon makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks.

Nightmare Breath.name: Nightmare Breath
Nightmare Breath.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=rQaVvnKj8M4SA05A]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=rQaVvnKj8M4SA05A]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair).

Immediately after another creature’s turn, the dragon can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The dragon regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Spore Salvo.name: Spore Salvo
Spore Salvo.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Rgw7pKnnGrBKiLTs]], one creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=Rgw7pKnnGrBKiLTs]] feet of the dragon that it can see.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Failure or Success: The dragon can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The dragon shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid or a Small or Medium Beast, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Corrosive Form.name: Corrosive Form
Corrosive Form.description:
A creature that hits the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with a melee attack roll takes [[/damage average]] damage. Nonmagical ammunition is destroyed immediately after hitting the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and dealing any damage. Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative −1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage to the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and coming into contact with it. The weapon is destroyed if the penalty reaches −5. The penalty can be removed by casting the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMending000]{Mending} spell on the weapon.

In 1 minute, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can eat through 2 feet of nonmagical wood or metal.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Attack Penalty active effect that will modify a targeted weapon. Since this penalty can be applied multiple times to multiple nonmagical weapons, this active effect needs to be dragged from this item's Effect tab onto the target Item's weapons.

Damaged: -1 Attack.name: Damaged: -1 Attack
Damaged: -1 Attack.description: Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative −1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage to the attacking creature and coming into contact with it.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Split.name: Split
Split.description: Trigger: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @activation.condition activity=zoXFSgzmWq8frUjI]] Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] splits into two new [[lookup @name capitalize]]. Each new [[lookup @name lowercase]] is one size smaller than the original [[lookup @name lowercase]] and acts on its Initiative. The original [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Hit Points are divided evenly between the new [[lookup @name lowercase]]s (round down).

Split.name: Split
Split.condition: is Large or Medium and has 10+ Hit Points, it becomes Bloodied or is subjected to Lightning or Slashing damage.

Dissolving Pseudopod.name: Dissolving Pseudopod
Dissolving Pseudopod.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. Nonmagical armor worn by the target takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. The penalty can be removed by casting the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMending000]{Mending} spell on the armor.

Damaged: -1 AC.name: Damaged: -1 AC
Damaged: -1 AC.description: Nonmagical armor worn by the target takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Icewind Dale) Adventure for

Level 9 Characters

Escape a deep dragon through the Underdark.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifUnderdarkTunn]{Underdark Tunnels}

Situation. Seer Echomorne (who is secretly the @UUID[Actor.aifAdultDeepDrag]{Adult Deep Dragon} Mornethraxys) found a beholder frozen below @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifTentownsGazet.JournalEntryPage.UDAfroDI54OORaVX]{Termalaine} and intends to use the creature to cement power in @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifTentownsGazet.JournalEntryPage.p3X5cvOBlHMvlr0y]{Bryn Shander}. She’s been prophesying doom for weeks while keeping the creature’s existence a secret.

Hook. The characters are in Termalaine when the beholder emerges from the mines and begins laying waste to everything and everyone nearby.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Terror in Termalaine. A disoriented, half-frozen @UUID[Actor.aifBeholder00000]{Beholder} assaults Termalaine.

Prophetic Dreams. After the attack, Echomorne’s supporters demand a vote to elect her speaker of Bryn Shander, saying she foresaw the disaster.

Mornethraxys Strikes. Echomorne identifies the party as a threat to her plans and resolves to bring them to her family. Reverting to her dragon shape, she chases them into a tunnel leading to the Underdark.

Giant Ruins. Mornethraxys chases or guides the characters through ruins in the Underdark, through a hall of fallen giants (@UUID[Actor.aifHauntingReven]{Haunting Revenant}), to a cavernous, ruined throne room.

Throne Room. Here, the characters eventually come face to face with Mornethraxys, her father Enderbalathal the Lord Below (@UUID[Actor.aifAncientDeepDr]{Ancient Deep Dragon}), and her brother Guvaali of the Grand Appetite (@UUID[Actor.aifAdultDeepDrag]{Adult Deep Dragon}), who interrogate the party for lore and secrets. When the characters are of no more use, the dragons hurl them down into an ooze swamp.

Ooze Swamp. In a dim and noxious swamp, the characters fight four @UUID[Actor.aifBlackPudding0]{Black Puddings} while searching for an escape. Meanwhile, gluttonous Guvaali decides to hunt them in the fog-filled swamp.

Frozen Horror. The only way out of the swamp is to climb a melting subterranean glacier to a distant steam vent. If the characters light a fire or shine a bright light, they discover true horror: the ice is full of aberrations frozen in a contorted mass, their tendrils reaching upward. Unless the thaw stops, these monsters will surely bring an eldritch apocalypse to Icewind Dale.

Near the Surface. The characters encounter three @UUID[Actor.aifGrickAncient0]{Grick Ancients}, as well as clusters of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.lVkdQivhFHqVmxg7#fireball-fungus]{fireball fungus} (see chapter 3 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide) as they clamber back to the surface. When they emerge from the steam vent, they are at Highplume Station.

Situation. Predator attacks have hit several ranches in Amphail. Unusual beasts have been spotted nearby. The Oglyntyr family, secretly lycanthropes and worshipers of Malar, are responsible.

Hook. Lord Warder Dauner Ilzimmer (Medium, Lawful Neutral Noble) sends for aid from other member cities in the Lords’ Alliance. He offers 150 GP per person to investigators, half in advance.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Faction (Lords' Alliance) Adventure for

Level 4 Characters

Solve a bestial murder.

Scenes: @UUID[Scene.dmgManor00000000]{Manor}, @UUID[Scene.dmgSpookyHouse00]{Spooky House}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.FtmfTKJf5PAi1AaK]{Wolves of Amphail}

Situation. Predator attacks have hit several ranches in Amphail. Unusual beasts have been spotted nearby. The Oglyntyr family, secretly lycanthropes and worshipers of Malar, are responsible.

Hook. Lord Warder Dauner Ilzimmer (Medium, Lawful Neutral @UUID[Actor.aifNoble00000000]{Noble}) sends for aid from other member cities in the Lords’ Alliance. He offers [[/award 150GP]] per person to investigators, half in advance.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Road Killers. Near Amphail, in the foothills of the Sword Mountain along the Long Road, three @UUID[Actor.aifPeryton000000]{Perytons} swoop down on the characters. The perytons hint at Malar’s involvement in this mystery.

Amphail Arrival. Lord Ilzimmer greets the party and hosts them in his Stone Stallion inn. He tells the party that he doesn’t want to choose sides, but the deep-rooted Oglyntyr family blames newcomers the Hemzars, who train dangerous creatures—Strem Hemzar recently slew an owlbear on Hemzar Ranch. But Riven Oglyntyr, who left decades ago to adventure, returned not long ago and could be involved. He needs an outside party to investigate.

Hemzar Ranch. When the party visits Hemzar Ranch, 7 miles west of Amphail, use the @UUID[Scene.dmgManor00000000]{Manor map} if needed. The Hemzars, all humans, largely cooperate with the investigation and instruct their four servants and ranch hands to do the same.

Hemzars

Name

Traits

Elyann

Quiet, wise herbalist; Strem’s wife (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoner})

Kalia

Witty, driven trainer and daughter (Medium, Lawful Good @UUID[Actor.aifScout00000000]{Scout})

Strem

Flighty, loyal trainer and son (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifWerewolf00000]{Werewolf})

Taero

Proud, practical father and patriarch (Medium, Lawful Neutral @UUID[Actor.aifNoble00000000]{Noble})

Vonda

Warm, sharp treasurer and matriarch (Medium, Neutral Good @UUID[Actor.aifNoble00000000]{Noble})

Strem slew a bloody owlbear a few weeks ago and has been ill ever since. The owlbear was sent by Malar, who cursed Strem to be a werewolf. He convalesces in the manor tower, and he and his family chain him up there at night, keeping the truth of his condition a secret.

The Hemzars assume Strem contracted lycanthropy from the owlbear. A character who takes a &Reference[Study] action and succeeds on a [[/skill 15 rel]] check recalls Malar sends blood-covered beasts out into the world, and he takes umbrage when they’re slain. Searching the Hemzar manor turns up an ivory idol of Malar in one of the barns, but the Hemzars don’t know where it came from.

Oglyntyr Ranch. Eight miles north of Amphail, Oglyntyr Ranch shows signs of neglect. Use the @UUID[Scene.dmgSpookyHouse00]{Spooky House} map if needed. The Oglyntyr basement houses a gory Malar shrine decorated with human heads and an owlbear skull.

The Oglyntyrs, all humans, have a nasty reputation. Riven became a lycanthrope while away on adventure and has brought Malar’s worship back to his family, all of whom are now cursed.

Oglyntyrs

Name

Traits

Dorn

Ruthless, sly trainer and patriarch (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifWereboar00000]{Wereboar})

Jhess

Affable, wayward trainer and son (Medium, Chaotic Neutral @UUID[Actor.aifWererat000000]{Wererat})

Mirin

Calm, cruel healer and matriarch (Medium, Neutral Evil @UUID[Actor.aifWerewolf00000]{Werewolf})

Riven

Ambitious, greedy uncle (Medium, Chaotic Evil @UUID[Actor.aifWeretiger0000]{Weretiger})

The family’s four remaining servants are @UUID[Actor.aifWererat000000]{Wererats}.

Sacred Hunt. When the party begins investigating the Oglyntyrs, the family pretends to cooperate and blames the Hemzars. But as the party discovers the shrine or otherwise gets close to the truth, the Oglyntyrs decide to kill the party and honor Malar by making them the object of a hunt. The family stalks the characters and harries them in the wilderness.

Use the following encounters, giving the party time to recover between each.

  • Dorn alongside Mirin.
  • Jhess and two servants. If Bloodied, these lycanthropes flee back to the ranch or surrender.
  • Riven, one servant, and one @UUID[Actor.aifPanther000000]{Panther}. If &Reference[Bloodied], the servant flees or surrenders, but Riven makes sure the cowardly servant dies.

Conclusion. Lord Ilzimmer is displeased if the Oglyntyrs come to harm, but if confronted with the evidence, he admits the family was likely responsible. Strem Hemzar’s hidden lycanthropy can prompt further adventure. Each character’s Renown Score with the Lords’ Alliance increases by 1.

The Summerlight Ceremony.name: The Summerlight Ceremony
The Summerlight Ceremony.description:
A High Magic Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

Fight off the winter in Icewind Dale.

Situation. A young human wizard named Povari Belendros (Medium, Chaotic Good Mage) has devised a potential means of preserving some of summer’s warmth even in the heart of winter. She calls her spell the Summerlight Ceremony. 

Hook. Povari hires the characters to procure a special reagent—bark from the luminous yew tree, harvested with a magical burning sickle—and to help her conduct her ceremony.

Mage.name: Mage
Mage.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcWand000000]{Wand}

Mages

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.BRPgUa1VGeHBz5BR caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Mage

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.G2fA16d9pkedAKnr caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm free-rules-embed"]

Wand.name: Wand
Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmArcaneBurst000]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConeofCold]{Cone of Cold}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

BtkwckQJktc8hRh0.name: Misty Step
BtkwckQJktc8hRh0.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Protective Magic.name: Protective Magic
Protective Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield} in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: when you see a creature within range casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: 你触碰一个未着装护甲的自愿生物。直至法术终止前，目标的基础AC变为 13 + 它的敏捷调整值。当目标穿上护甲时，此法术将提前终止。

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.description:
You unleash a blast of cold air. Each creature in a 60-foot Cone originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

materials.value: a small crystal or glass cone

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Azer Pyromancer.description:
Azers

Fire Aura.name: Fire Aura
Fire Aura.description: At the end of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns, each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average]] damage unless the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the Incapacitated condition.

damage.condition: at the end of each of this creature's turns

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes makes two [[/item .mmFlameBurst0000]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplElementali], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFireball00]

Elementalism.name: Elementalism
Elementalism.description:
You exert control over the elements, creating one of the following effects within range.

Beckon Air. You create a breeze strong enough to ripple cloth, stir dust, rustle leaves, and close open doors and shutters, all in a 5-foot Cube. Doors and shutters being held open by someone or something aren’t affected.

Beckon Earth. You create a thin shroud of dust or sand that covers surfaces in a 5-foot-square area, or you cause a single word to appear in your handwriting in a patch of dirt or sand.

Beckon Fire. You create a thin cloud of harmless embers and colored, scented smoke in a 5-foot Cube. You choose the color and scent, and the embers can light candles, torches, or lamps in that area. The smoke’s scent lingers for 1 minute.

Beckon Water. You create a spray of cool mist that lightly dampens creatures and objects in a 5-foot Cube. Alternatively, you create 1 cup of clean water either in an open container or on a surface, and the water evaporates in 1 minute.

Sculpt Element. You cause dirt, sand, fire, smoke, mist, or water that can fit in a 1-foot Cube to assume a crude shape (such as that of a creature) for 1 hour.

Beckon Element.name: Beckon Element
Beckon Element.chatFlavor: Fire and water beckoning lasts for 1 minute

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Hellish Rebuke.name: Hellish Rebuke
Hellish Rebuke.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHellishReb]{Hellish Rebuke} in response to that spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

lJ0WsCTDWAMXkc03.name: Hellish Rebuke
lJ0WsCTDWAMXkc03.description:
The creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by green flames. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

activation.condition: taking damage from a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself

Drow of Lolth.name: Drow of Lolth
Drow of Lolth.description: Throughout the vast Underdark, in cities such as Menzoberranzan, many drow worship Lolth, the Spider Queen. Exiled from the surface world millennia ago, these drow now consider the Underdark to be their true home. Their insidious schemes include raiding the surface, plotting against each other, and preparing for ultimate war.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11):

At Will: [[/item .N9sKPzLyNMFdHiGv]]{Dancing Lights}

1/Day: [[/item .zUOMBKlghcwlxqQk]]{Faerie Fire}

Drow Hand Crossbow.name: Drow Hand Crossbow
Drow Hand Crossbow.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]., and the target makes a saving throw.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=XPUznl9nCszD1Pno]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. If the target fails the save by 5 or more, it also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while Poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: You have the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: If you fail the save by 5 or more, it also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while Poisoned in this way. You wake up if it takes damage or if a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: The drow has Advantage on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the Charmed condition, and magic can’t put the drow to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the drow has Disadvantage on attack rolls.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
你在施法距离内创造至多四个火把大小的光源，使其在法术持续时间内看起来如同火把、灯笼或悬浮珠。或者，你可以将四个光源合并为一个发光的整体形态，使其看上去像一个模糊的中型人形。无论你选择哪种形态，每个光源都会发出 10 尺半径的微光光照 。

你可以用附赠动作将光源移动至多 60 尺至施法距离内的一处空间。一个由此法术创造的光源必须始终位于任一光源周围 20 尺内，而超出施法距离的光源会随即熄灭。

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Drow Elite Warrior of Lolth.name: Drow Elite Warrior of Lolth
Drow Elite Warrior of Lolth.description:
Throughout the vast Underdark, in cities such as Menzoberranzan, many drow worship Lolth, the Spider Queen. Exiled from the surface world millennia ago, these drow now consider the Underdark to be their true home. Their insidious schemes include raiding the surface, plotting against each other, and preparing for ultimate war.

Elite warriors of Lolth lead raids and command garrisons in the Underdark.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The drow makes two attacks using [[/item Shortsword]] or [[/item Drow Hand Crossbow]] in any combination

Underdark Magic.name: Underdark Magic
Underdark Magic.description: The drow casts [[/item .SGv0Ors6jSniB0vz]]{Darkness}, [[/item .LziWJ8GKT0syE7ZB]]{Faerie Fire}, or [[/item .WbDKqhGWpwXVyfpF]]{Levitate}] (self only), requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12).

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: The drow has Advantage on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the Charmed condition, and magic can’t put the drow to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the drow has Disadvantage on attack rolls.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Levitate.name: Levitate
Levitate.description:
One creature or loose object of your choice that you can see within range rises vertically up to 20 feet and remains suspended there for the duration. The spell can levitate an object that weighs up to 500 pounds. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Constitution saving throw is unaffected.

The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. You can change the target's altitude by up to 20 feet in either direction on your turn. If you are the target, you can move up or down as part of your move. Otherwise, you can take a Magic action to move the target, which must remain within the spell's range.

When the spell ends, the target floats gently to the ground if it is still aloft.

Levitating.name: Levitating
Levitating.description: The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing.

Drow Hand Crossbow.name: Drow Hand Crossbow
Drow Hand Crossbow.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]., and the target makes a saving throw.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=XPUznl9nCszD1Pno]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. If the target fails the save by 5 or more, it also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while Poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: You have the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: If you fail the save by 5 or more, it also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while Poisoned in this way. You wake up if it takes damage or if a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Drow Priestess of Lolth.name: Drow Priestess of Lolth
Drow Priestess of Lolth.description:
Throughout the vast Underdark, in cities such as Menzoberranzan, many drow worship Lolth, the Spider Queen. Exiled from the surface world millennia ago, these drow now consider the Underdark to be their true home. Their insidious schemes include raiding the surface, plotting against each other, and preparing for ultimate war.

Lolth’s worship is matriarchal, and only female drow can rise to become priestesses of the Spider Queen or rule a noble house.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: [[/item .x5ztHmnJAzeGaVg1]]{Dancing Lights}, [[/item .ShxcJ6YIFclSo0oS]]{Guidance}, [[/item .5aVivxEaBwsYRoMm]]{Thaumaturgy}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The drow makes three [[/item Scourge]] attacks.

Spider Vortex.name: Spider Vortex
Spider Vortex.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=kSLdo9Kl1zSBxlRT]], each enemy in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=kSLdo9Kl1zSBxlRT]]-foot Emanation originating from the drow.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the start of the drow’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: You have the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the start of the drow’s next turn.

Lolth’s Blessing.name: Lolth’s Blessing
Lolth’s Blessing.description: The drow casts [[/item .0vPfjvEETbtTBxFp]]{Cure Wounds}, [[/item .dPSdS7u82ECTT0YU]]{Darkness}, [[/item .2hWTd3WRkhbiwO3U]]{Dispel Magic}, or [[/item .v6KGqoDyO1xAk6cu]]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: The drow has Advantage on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the Charmed condition, and magic can’t put the drow to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the drow has Disadvantage on attack rolls.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
你在施法距离内创造至多四个火把大小的光源，使其在法术持续时间内看起来如同火把、灯笼或悬浮珠。或者，你可以将四个光源合并为一个发光的整体形态，使其看上去像一个模糊的中型人形。无论你选择哪种形态，每个光源都会发出 10 尺半径的微光光照 。

你可以用附赠动作将光源移动至多 60 尺至施法距离内的一处空间。一个由此法术创造的光源必须始终位于任一光源周围 20 尺内，而超出施法距离的光源会随即熄灭。

Guidance.name: Guidance
Guidance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a skill. Until the spell ends, the creature adds 1d4 to any ability check using the chosen skill.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Siege Monster.name: Siege Monster
Siege Monster.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] deals double damage to objects and structures.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item mmSlam0000000000]] attacks.

Animate Trees.name: Animate Trees
Animate Trees.description: The [[lookup @name]] magically animates up to two trees it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=EceTNjzjKWdrMNAy]] feet of itself. Each tree uses the Treant stat block, except it has Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, it can't speak, and it lacks this action. The tree takes its turn immediately after the treant on the same initiative count, and it obeys the treant. A tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies, the treant dies, or it is more than 120 feet from the treant. The tree then takes root if possible.

affects.special: Trees it can see within range

Animate Trees.name: Animate Trees
Animate Trees.description: The tree has Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, can't speak, and lacks the Animate Trees action.

Heat Aura.description: At the end of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns, each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=LDcQJj3oXyPCuCaT]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=LDcQJj3oXyPCuCaT]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average]] damage.

If the target is a [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=xWlMeXFjELfSUWX9]] creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: If the target is a [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=xWlMeXFjELfSUWX9]] creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=YorssyWMumAsvzx3]], [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=YorssyWMumAsvzx3]] by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] (it can have up to two creatures swallowed at a time).

Failure: The target is swallowed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and the Grappled condition ends. A swallowed creature has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, it has &Reference[Total Cover] against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and it takes [[/damage average activity=zrWNjO9mkbN28spL]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long activity=rGeGukkm2t2fXsoy]] at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within [[lookup @range.value activity=rGeGukkm2t2fXsoy]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting Prone.

affects.special: one Large or smaller creature Grappled

Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover.name: Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover
Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover.description: While swallowed, a creature has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, has &Reference[Total Cover apply=false] against attacks.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If you are regurgitated, you fall into a space within 10 ft. and are &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A High Magic Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

Fight off the winter in Icewind Dale.

Scenes: @UUID[Scene.aifUnderdarkWarr]{Underdark Warren}, @UUID[Scene.aifSummerlightCe]{Roadside Inn}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.H7zB6zASEfQcuYmz]{The Summerlight Ceremony}

Situation. A young human wizard named Povari Belendros (Medium, Chaotic Good @UUID[Actor.aifMage000000000]{Mage}) has devised a potential means of preserving some of summer’s warmth even in the heart of winter. She calls her spell the Summerlight Ceremony. 

Hook. Povari hires the characters to procure a special reagent—bark from the luminous yew tree, harvested with a magical burning sickle—and to help her conduct her ceremony. 

Encounters 

The characters must complete these steps. 

Obtain the Sickle. An @UUID[Actor.aifAzerPyromance]{Azer Pyromancer} named Caserrium living in the caves beneath Kelvin’s Cairn has crafted the burning sickle. He agrees to give it to the characters if they drive out a band of drow cultists lurking beneath the mountain. The drow include twelve @UUID[Actor.aifDrowofLolth00]{Drow of Lolth} and two @UUID[Actor.aifDrowEliteWarr]{Drow Elite Warriors of Lolth} led by a @UUID[Actor.aifDrowPriestess]{Drow Priestess of Lolth}; see chapter 9 for all these stat blocks. Use the @UUID[Scene.aifUnderdarkWarr]{Underdark Warren} map from appendix B in the Dungeon Master’s Guide for their lair. If the characters defeat or drive off the drow, Caserrium is good to his word and gives the party the sickle.

Luminous Yew. The luminous yew is a massive, magical tree in an ominous copse in the Lonelywood. A greedy, Chaotic Evil @UUID[Actor.aifTreant0000000]{Treant} guards the tree and fights the party on sight. Once the treant is destroyed, the party can collect the bark using the sickle.

Conducting the Ceremony. Back in Targos, Povari leads the characters in a ceremony around a giant bonfire. The taxing ritual takes 24 hours, at the end of which each character must succeed on a [[/save wis 15 format=long]] or gain 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level. 

Just as Povari is finishing the ceremony, a @UUID[Actor.aifRemorhaz00000]{Remorhaz} bursts from the ground. Use the ground floor of the @UUID[Scene.aifSummerlightCe]{Roadside Inn} map from appendix B in the Dungeon Master’s Guide. As long as the party defeats the creature, the ceremony is successful.

Rusted Berserker.name: Rusted Berserker
Rusted Berserker.description:
Construct Victims of a Supernatural Curse

The supernatural Rusting curse that pervades the Moonshae Isles manifests as a thin scrim of iron over a living creature’s skin. This coarse iron rusts easily, turning the creature a sickly orange gray. Unchecked, this curse transforms the victim into a Rusted, an animated iron caricature of itself that sheds flakes of toxic rust.

As the Rusting curse hardens the skin, it also hollows out the mind. Rusted creatures despise unspoiled nature and are compelled to destroy it when they can.

Other Rusted

You can turn any Beast, Fey, Giant, Humanoid, or Monstrosity into a Rusted version of itself by doing the following: change the creature’s type to Construct, and give it Immunity to Poison damage and the Exhaustion, Petrified, and Poisoned conditions.

Rusted Berserker

A Rusted berserker is a human Norlander transformed by the Rusting. These berserkers have forsaken the traditional Norlander lifestyle to rage against nature and its protectors.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Moonshae Isles) Adventure for

Level 3 Characters

Save a moonwell from the Rusting.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifMoonwell00000]{Moonwell}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.HPBWbA3WRm4B1oyy]{The Rushdown Well}

Situation. Environmental neglect, pollution, and deforestation have led to the appearance of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifMagicOfTheMoo.JournalEntryPage.qkVhCaUIA1vueE9D]{the Rusting} in the settlement of Kythyss and up Alaron’s southeast coast.

Hook. The gnome mayor of Kythyss, Grel Shivven (Small, Lawful Neutral @UUID[Actor.aifNoble00000000]{Noble}), hires the characters to visit sites where the Rusting has appeared and figure out why the curse is present.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters. Rusted creatures feature heavily in this adventure; to modify stat blocks into Rusted versions see the “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifBestiary00000.JournalEntryPage.EPxseka41oW3goRm#other-rusted]{Other Rusted}” sidebar in chapter 9.

Kythyss Wharf. Here, the characters find sewage from Kythyss dumping into the harbor. The sewer tunnel is home to a @UUID[Actor.aifWererat000000]{Wererat} and six @UUID[Actor.aifGiantRat00000]{Giant Rats}. If the sewage is redirected into septic tanks or cleaned before reintroduction to the harbor, the Rusting withdraws.

Bregonshire Coast. The Rusting continues up the rocky coast between Kythyss and Dorset, where dead fish wash ashore. As the characters investigate, a @UUID[Actor.aifKuotoaMonitor]{Kuo-toa Monitor} and four @UUID[Actor.aifKuotoa0000000]{Kuo-toa} emerge from the sea to fight. Speaking with local farmers reveals they’re using an alchemical fertilizer that is washed into the sea by rain.

Rushdown Wood. North of Dorset, the trees of Rushdown Wood are covered in a thin, metal skin, and their leaves have turned to rust. Lumbering efforts have penetrated deep into the forest, leaving behind fields of stumps. Rusted Norlanders have infiltrated the Rushdown Wood; a @UUID[Actor.aifRustedBerserk]{Rusted Berserker} and six @UUID[Actor.aifRustedGuardCo]{Rusted Guards} attack when discovered. The characters can follow their trail back to an abandoned camp near the local moonwell; plans drawn in the dirt reveal a Rusted force is attacking the well.

The Moonwell. Use the Moonwell map below for these encounters. When the characters rush to the moonwell’s defense, they must first get past three @UUID[Actor.aifRustedScout00]{Rusted Scouts} in the trees to reach the main Rusted force, which is engaged with local druids and their allies. The characters must defeat four @UUID[Actor.aifRustedGuardCo]{Rusted Guards} and two Rusted @UUID[Actor.aifRustedWolf000]{Rusted Wolves} before they can reach the leader of the assault: a @UUID[Actor.aifRustedWarrior]{Rusted Warrior Veteran}. If the leader is defeated, the remaining Rusted flee and the moonwell is saved.

Aftermath. Mayor Shivven can’t address all the problems the characters have discovered with the resources he has at hand, but he’s grateful for their efforts. He rewards each character with [[/award 100GP]].

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.RrS1c0zz7MHOI3Wn caption=false]

The Eyes of At'ar.name: The Eyes of At'ar
The Eyes of At'ar.description:
A Region (Anauroch) Adventure for

Level 5 Characters

Negotiate the return of a hostage and the dangerous magic he carries.

Situation. A bandit gang called the Eyes of At’ar has kidnapped Sullivan Crase, an antiquarian employed by Candlekeep. The gang offers to exchange Sullivan for 10,000 GP, instructing that the exchange take place at a lonely caravansary along the Black Road called Kozah’s Whisper.

Hook. Janussi (Medium Archmage), Candlekeep’s Keeper of Tomes, meets the characters in a private room at a tavern in Baldur’s Gate and shares with them the ransom note detailing the gang’s demands. The Eyes of At’ar write they will be at Kozah’s Whisper in one month and will wait one month more for Candlekeep’s representatives to make the trade. After that, Sullivan will be killed. Janussi confides that Sullivan was carrying a scroll of priceless Netherese magic when he was abducted. She refuses to encourage the bandits by paying the ransom. She offers the party 1,500 GP plus expenses if they will travel to Kozah’s Whisper and secure Sullivan and the scroll.

Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes four [[/item .mmArcaneBurst000]] attacks.

lSbRnSVRWsTQoh2w.name: Misty Step
lSbRnSVRWsTQoh2w.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Protective Magic.name: Protective Magic
Protective Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield} in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: when you see a creature within range casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt} (level 7 version)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConeofCold]{Cone of Cold} (level 9 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMindBlank0]{Mind Blank} (cast before combat), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplTeleport00]{Teleport}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: 你触碰一个未着装护甲的自愿生物。直至法术终止前，目标的基础AC变为 13 + 它的敏捷调整值。当目标穿上护甲时，此法术将提前终止。

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a bit of fur and a crystal rod

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.description:
You unleash a blast of cold air. Each creature in a 60-foot Cone originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

materials.value: a small crystal or glass cone

Mind Blank.name: Mind Blank
Mind Blank.description: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch has Immunity to Psychic damage and the Charmed condition. The target is also unaffected by anything that would sense its emotions or alignment, read its thoughts, or magically detect its location, and no spell—not even @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish}—can gather information about the target, observe it remotely, or control its mind.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn't know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target's …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

materials.value: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

affects.special: creature on same plane of existence or a location you have seen
at target location or within 10 feet of target creature

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description:
This spell instantly transports you and up to eight willing creatures that you can see within range, or a single object that you can see within range, to a destination you select. If you target an object, it must be Large or smaller, and it can't be held or carried by an unwilling creature.

The destination you choose must be known to you, and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. Your familiarity with the destination determines whether you arrive there successfully. The DM rolls [[/gmr 1d100]] and consults the Teleportation Outcome table and the explanations after it.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplTeleportMi]{Teleportation Outcome}
FamiliarityMishapSimilar AreaOff TargetOn Target
Permanent circle———01–00
Linked object———01–00
Very familiar01–0506–1314–2425–00
Seen casually01–3334–4344–5354–00
Viewed once or described01–4344–5354–7374–00
False destination01–5051–00——

Familiarity. Here are the meanings of the terms in the table's Familiarity column:

  • "Permanent circle" means a permanent teleportation circle whose sigil sequence you know.
  • "Linked object" means you possess an object taken from the desired destination within the last six months, such as a book from a wizard's library.
  • "Very familiar" is a place you have visited often, a place you have carefully studied, or a place you can see when you cast the spell.
  • "Seen casually" is a place you have seen more than once but with which you aren't very familiar.
  • "Viewed once or described" is a place you have seen once, possibly using magic, or a place you know through someone else's description, perhaps from a map.
  • "False destination" is a place that doesn't exist. Perhaps you tried to scry an enemy's sanctum but instead viewed an illusion, or you are attempting to teleport to a location that no longer exists.

Mishap. The spell's unpredictable magic results in a difficult journey. Each teleporting creature (or the target object) takes [[/damage 3d10 type=force]] damage, and the DM rerolls on the table to see where you wind up (multiple mishaps can occur, dealing damage each time).

Similar Area. You and your group (or the target object) appear in a different area that's visually or thematically similar to the target area. You appear in the closest similar place. If you are heading for your home laboratory, for example, you might appear in another person's laboratory in the same city.

Off Target. You and your group (or the target object) appear [[/r 2d12]] miles away from the destination in a random direction. Roll [[/r 1d8]] for the direction: 1, east; 2, southeast; 3, south; 4, southwest; 5, west; 6, northwest; 7, north; or 8, northeast.

On Target. You and your group (or the target object) appear where you intended.

affects.special: you and up to eight creatures or one object

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmCorruptingTouc]].

Corrupting Touch.name: Corrupting Touch
Corrupting Touch.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=F4cByCi1IEouN08a]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=F4cByCi1IEouN08a]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=F4cByCi1IEouN08a]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] and &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] conditions.

Cursed, Charmed & Poisoned.name: Cursed, Charmed & Poisoned
Cursed, Charmed & Poisoned.description: Until the curse ends, the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] and &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] conditions.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self} (can appear as a Large or Medium biped), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGeas000000]{Geas}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}

Leap.name: Leap
Leap.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] jumps up to [[lookup @range.value activity=C28C43DeD8iFtZMe]] feet by [[lookup @activation.condition activity=C28C43DeD8iFtZMe]].

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Geas.name: Geas
Geas.description:
You give a verbal command to a creature that you can see within range, ordering it to carry out some service or refrain from an action or a course of activity as you decide. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target automatically succeeds if it can't understand your command.

While Charmed, the creature takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psychic]] damage if it acts in a manner directly counter to your command. It takes this damage no more than once each day.

You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. Should you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends.

A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell ends this spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. If you use a level 7 or 8 spell slot, the duration is 365 days. If you use a level 9 spell slot, the spell lasts until it is ended by one of the spells mentioned above.

Under Orders.name: Under Orders
Under Orders.description: While &Reference[Charmed apply=false], the creature takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psyhic]] damage if it acts in a manner directly counter to your command. It takes this damage no more than once each day.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can't deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn't know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target's …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

materials.value: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

affects.special: creature on same plane of existence or a location you have seen
at target location or within 10 feet of target creature
