Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Shortsword.name: Shortsword
Shortsword.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the assassin's next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the assassin’s next turn.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .jLa5l9pntsTVrMKH]] or [[/item .dL4668G7zXeC5zyY]] in any combination.

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash apply=false], the &Reference[Disengage apply=false], or &Reference[Hide apply=false] action.

Tough Boss.name: Tough Boss
Tough Boss.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmChainMail0]{Chain Mail}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepHeavyCross]{Heavy Crossbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepWarhammer0]{Warhammer}

Warhammer.name: Warhammer
Warhammer.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] pushes the target up to 10 feet straight away from itself.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .iD5121TXziB6ZcSt]] or [[/item .7MS7v84QoTYESVax]] in any combination.

Tough.name: Tough
Tough.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepHeavyCross]{Heavy Crossbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmLeatherArm]{Leather Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepMace000000]{Mace}

Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Bandit Deceiver.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepDagger0000]{Daggers (6)}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbafcWand000000]{Wand}

Wand.name: Wand
Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .l4INK64V3wIju2AS]] attacks.

Blinding Flash.name: Blinding Flash
Blinding Flash.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Onad9uNiCzAMfuwf]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Onad9uNiCzAMfuwf]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=Onad9uNiCzAMfuwf]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the start of the user’s next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Scout.name: Scout
Scout.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmLeatherArm]{Leather Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepLongbow000]{Longbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepShortsword]{Shortsword}

Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmRend0000000000]] or [[/item .mmTailSpike00000]] in any combination.

Phaerimm Agent.name: Phaerimm Agent
Phaerimm Agent.description:
Alien, Magic-Obsessed Manipulators

Phaerimm are malevolent alien beings that seek to dominate other sentient species. A phaerimm’s conical body ripples through the air, trailing behind a large, flat mouth ringed by four delicate arms. A phaerimm’s body tapers to a venomous stinger they prefer to use only when magical means fail them.

Ancient phaerimm devastated the once-powerful empire of Netheril. The phaerimm were imprisoned beneath the great desert of Anauroch, where they plot a return to their former dominion. Roll or choose a result from the Phaerimm Plots table as inspiration for what a phaerimm agent might be doing when encountered.

@embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifPhaerimmPlots rollable resultLabel="The Phaerimm Is …"]

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The phaerimm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

At Will: [[/item .pEhiVsn7tpKoz6xR]]{Detect Magic}, [[/item .ozub6AoxcwAzhZBw]]{Detect Thoughts}, [[/item .PexcN93VXsgT57aA]]{Mage Hand}

1/Day Each: [[/item .E6fYjUUZ0mXwABZC]]{Clairvoyance}, [[/item .wVxjEuMkpLWo409n]]{Major Image}, [[/item .ij2fAAlPK5yFwx5B]]{Synaptic Static}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The phaerimm makes three attacks, using [[/item Dread Stinger]] or [[/item Mindwarp Ray]] in any combination.

Mindwarp Ray.name: Mindwarp Ray
Mindwarp Ray.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]., and the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the phaerimm’s next turn.

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description: The phaerimm teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Protective Magic.name: Protective Magic
Protective Magic.description: The phaerimm casts [[/item .0EN7pI6wKid62eU4]]{Counterspell} or [[/item .zSg8AXbTvTo6HcpO]]{Shield} in response to the spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Clairvoyance.name: Clairvoyance
Clairvoyance.description:
You create an Invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you (a place you have visited or seen before) or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you (such as behind a door, around a corner, or in a grove of trees). The intangible, invulnerable sensor remains in place for the duration.

When you cast the spell, choose seeing or hearing. You can use the chosen sense through the sensor as if you were in its space. As a Bonus Action, you can switch between seeing and hearing.

A creature that sees the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from See Invisibility or &Reference[truesight]) sees a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

materials.value: a focus worth 100+ GP, either a jeweled horn for hearing or a glass eye for seeing

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can't deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: when you see a creature within range casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Synaptic Static.name: Synaptic Static
Synaptic Static.description:
You cause psychic energy to erupt at a point within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes an Intelligence saving throw, taking 8d6 Psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

On a failed save, a target also has muddled thoughts for 1 minute. During that time, it subtracts [[/r 1d6]] from all its attack rolls and ability checks, as well as any Constitution saving throws to maintain Concentration. The target makes an [[/save ability=int dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Muddled Thoughts.name: Muddled Thoughts
Muddled Thoughts.description: The target subtracts 1d6 from all its attack rolls and ability checks, as well as any Constitution saving throws to maintain Concentration. The target makes an [[/save ability=int format=long]] at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Region (Anauroch) Adventure for

Level 5 Characters

Negotiate the return of a hostage and the dangerous magic he carries.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifTheEyesOfAtar]{Roadside Inn}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.P45oEDgC1TaQaRsD]{The Eyes of At'ar}

Situation. A bandit gang called the Eyes of At’ar has kidnapped Sullivan Crase, an antiquarian employed by Candlekeep. The gang offers to exchange Sullivan for 10,000 GP, instructing that the exchange take place at a lonely caravansary along the Black Road called Kozah’s Whisper.

Hook. Janussi (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifArchmage00000]{Archmage}), Candlekeep’s Keeper of Tomes, meets the characters in a private room at a tavern in Baldur’s Gate and shares with them the ransom note detailing the gang’s demands. The Eyes of At’ar write they will be at Kozah’s Whisper in one month and will wait one month more for Candlekeep’s representatives to make the trade. After that, Sullivan will be killed. Janussi confides that Sullivan was carrying a scroll of priceless Netherese magic when he was abducted. She refuses to encourage the bandits by paying the ransom. She offers the party [[/award 1500GP]] plus expenses if they will travel to Kozah’s Whisper and secure Sullivan and the scroll.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Doing Their Homework. Characters might seek to use Candlekeep’s resources to learn more about their mission. Anyone wishing to enter the library must provide a work of writing the library doesn’t already have. Characters researching in the library learn the gang’s name refers to At’ar the Merciless, the Bedine god of the sun. Characters can acquire maps suggesting possible routes to Anauroch. An obscure scouting report describes the leader of the Eyes of At’ar as a mysterious “half-lion” spellcaster named Inixera (@UUID[Actor.aifLamia00000000]{Lamia}). The report cautions that the gang has eyes everywhere. You can find more information on Candlekeep to flesh out this part of the adventure in the Candlekeep Mysteries adventure anthology.

The Journey. The characters have a long journey ahead of them. One option is to take the Trade Way north to Daggerford, then turn east along the Delimbyr Trail until they reach the Black Road and Anauroch. Alternatively, the party might travel cross-country, skirting the Forest of Wyrms, Marsh of Chelimber, and Lonely Moor. Use the rules for @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbExploration00.JournalEntryPage.CIKNTZvYHNPixLRp]{travel} and journey stages in chapter 2 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide.

Kozah’s Whisper. Kozah’s Whisper is a caravansary halfway along the Black Road, in the middle of the Great Desert. Use the @UUID[Scene.aifTheEyesOfAtar]{Roadside Inn} map. Characters who used magic to travel to Kozah’s Whisper might get there before the bandits, but its more likely the gang has already arrived.

The caravansary is managed by a human woman named Enla Massine (Medium, Chaotic Neutral @UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoner}) who has survived in Anauroch by not getting involved in the business of her guests. She is assisted by her wife, Nari (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifAssassin00000]{Assassin}), who serves as a bouncer and general laborer. The two are fiercely loyal to each other. Their three adult children (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoners}) work as cooks, grooms, and cleaning staff. Other guests at the caravansary include the following:

Lorna, a nosy human merchant (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoner}) lingering at Kozah’s Rest while her pack animals recover from a difficult journey. Lorna is a source for gossip at the caravansary, and she can sell the party any gear they might need, including a few Spell Scrolls.

Mikkam, a halfling lieutenant in the Eyes of At’ar (Small, Chaotic Neutral @UUID[Actor.aifToughBoss0000]{Tough Boss}). He leads eight @UUID[Actor.aifTough00000000]{Toughs}.

Nama, a wandering elf mage (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifBanditDeceive]{Bandit Deceiver}) pursuing lost Netherese lore. If Nama learns about the Netherese scriptures, she might offer her services to the party in exchange for the scroll—or simply try to steal it.

Raheel, a human tracker (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifScout00000000]{Scout}). Raheel is looking for work. The party can hire him for 100 GP. He will spy on the Eyes of At’ar or anyone else the party directs him to, but he avoids combat.

The party has time to investigate the caravansary and guests while meeting with Mikkam to set up the exchange. Once convinced the party intends to make the deal, Mikkam sends word to Inixera, leader of the gang, at a bandit camp half a day away in the desert.

The Exchange. Inixera arrives a day after being sent for, with the bulk of the gang in tow. This includes four @UUID[Actor.aifBanditCaptain]{Bandit Captains} and two dozen @UUID[Actor.aifBandit0000000]{Bandits}, and Gnasher, Inixera’s pet @UUID[Actor.aifManticore0000]{Manticore}. Sullivan is manacled and gagged, in Gnasher’s care. Inixera has the Netherese texts in an elaborate scroll case, hidden in a simple sack.

When Inixera confronts the party, he changes the terms of the deal. He will release Sullivan if the party agrees to read the scroll aloud, right now, in the open yard of the caravansary. Inixera has read the scriptures and knows they summon a @UUID[Actor.aifPhaerimmAgent] (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifBestiary00000.JournalEntryPage.tS4vS4Wqd1A5Kljq]{chapter 9}). If the characters go through with this bargain, the phaerimm appears and fights them while Inixera looks on, cackling with glee. If they refuse, Inixera intends to feed Sullivan to Gnasher and keep the scrolls for himself.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.YsJCgr3GXtV3IU2X caption=false]

The Temple of Transmutation.name: The Temple of Transmutation
The Temple of Transmutation.description:
A Location (Dalelands) Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

Explore the magic of Myth Drannor.

Situation. Letha Salen, a Shadovar survivor of the crash of Thultanthar, has entered the Temple of Transmutation, an ancient magical research institute in Myth Drannor. Using a transmutation chamber in the temple, she’s transforming people and animals into monsters under her command.

Hook. Monster attacks on the edge of Cormanthor suddenly increase. Foresters report the creatures are coming from a large ruin just inside the walls of Myth Drannor. The leader of the local dale, or perhaps the Dales Council, asks the characters to find out what’s going on and stop the monster attacks.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Sense Magic.name: Sense Magic
Sense Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] senses magic within 120 feet of itself. This trait otherwise works like the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic} spell but isn’t itself magical.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes 2 [[/item Pincer]] attacks and uses [[/item Paralyzing Tentacles]].

Paralyzing Tentacles.name: Paralyzing Tentacles
Paralyzing Tentacles.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]] Grappled by the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Poisoned & Paralyzed.name: Poisoned & Paralyzed
Poisoned & Paralyzed.description:
The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Pincer.name: Pincer
Pincer.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of two pincers.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]).

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Spell Immunity.name: Spell Immunity
Spell Immunity.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to three spells chosen by its creator. Typical choices include @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHeatMetal0]{Heat Metal}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Arcane Sword]] attacks.

Battleaxe.name: Battleaxe
Battleaxe.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Morningstar.name: Morningstar
Morningstar.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Next Attack: Disadv..name: Next Attack: Disadv.
Next Attack: Disadv..description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .2zUJENAN0VZgqxYm]] attack and one [[/item .5LN8JEIko2tgE2WO]] attack.

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds Bright Light in a 15-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 15 feet.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Undead Restoration.name: Undead Restoration
Undead Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed, it regains all its Hit Points in 1 hour unless @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHolyWater00]{Holy Water} is sprinkled on its remains or the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good} spell is cast on them.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .Wmqg7e8xqYtT848N]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile} (level 2 version)

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart strikes a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 Force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell creates one more dart for each spell slot level above 1.

[[2 + @item.level]]{Level [[lookup @item.level]] darts}

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attack and one [[/item .mmTail0000000000]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]])). While Grappled, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=falsse] condition and can’t be targeted by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Tail.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC). While Grappled, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=falsse] condition.

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrow Speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmRend0000000000]] attacks

Confusing Gaze.name: Confusing Gaze
Confusing Gaze.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=tvHG0MEXOUVoCLuO]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=tvHG0MEXOUVoCLuO]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target can’t take &Reference[Reaction] until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The target makes a melee attack against a random creature within its reach or does nothing if it can’t make such an attack.

Loathsome Limbs.name: Loathsome Limbs
Loathsome Limbs.description:
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ends any turn Bloodied and took 15+ Slashing damage during that turn, one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]l's limbs is severed, falls into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space, and becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmTrollLimb00000]{Troll Limb}. The limb acts immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb, and it grows replacement limbs the next time it regains Hit Points.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect condition in the character sheet's Effects tab to enable each level of Exhaustion. Since the condition can be applied multiple times, the GM must manually manage the level of Exhaustion. There is an active effect available for each level of exhaustion.

Exhaustion 1.name: Exhaustion 1
Exhaustion 1.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion 2.name: Exhaustion 2
Exhaustion 2.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion 3.name: Exhaustion 3
Exhaustion 3.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion 4.name: Exhaustion 4
Exhaustion 4.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion 5.name: Exhaustion 5
Exhaustion 5.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion Dead.name: Exhaustion Dead
Exhaustion Dead.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=5cGvjZJIJVicjJ3d]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

heal.condition: starts its turn with at least 1 Hit Point

Charge.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to [[lookup @range.special activity=Y2IncZu5BjB42z7l]] straight toward an enemy it can see.

Success: The target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the Paralyzed condition until the start of the user's next turn unless the target has Immunity to Cold damage.

Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmForeleg0000000]] or [[/item .mmPoisonBurst000]] in any combination.

Magic of the Spider Queen.name: Magic of the Spider Queen
Magic of the Spider Queen.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWeb0000000]{Web}, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]).

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Web.name: Web
Web.description:
You conjure a mass of sticky webbing at a point within range. The webs fill a 20-foot Cube there for the duration. The webs are &Reference[difficultterrain], and the area within them is &Reference[lightlyobscured].

If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.

The first time a creature enters the webs on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained] condition while in the webs or until it breaks free.

A creature Restrained by the webs can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer Restrained.

The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot Cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing [[/damage 2d4 type=fire]] damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmRam00000000000]] attack, one [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attack, and one [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attack. It can replace the Claw attack with a use of [[/item .mmFireBreath0000]] if available.

Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], or [[/damage average activity=HN2sfAtHqDMjMLXF]] damage if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] had Advantage on the attack roll.

Ram.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success:Half damage.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attacks and one [[/item .mmSnakeHair00000]] attack, or it makes three [[/item .mmPoisonRay00000]] attacks.

Petrifying Gaze.name: Petrifying Gaze
Petrifying Gaze.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]]. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] sees its reflection in the [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make this save.

First Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Second Failure: The target has the &Reference[Petrified apply=false] condition instead of the Restrained condition.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Petrified.name: Petrified
Petrified.description: The target has the &Reference[Petrified apply=false] condition instead of the Restrained condition.

Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmArcaneBurst000]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConeofCold]{Cone of Cold}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

BtkwckQJktc8hRh0.name: Misty Step
BtkwckQJktc8hRh0.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Protective Magic.name: Protective Magic
Protective Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield} in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: when you see a creature within range casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: 你触碰一个未着装护甲的自愿生物。直至法术终止前，目标的基础AC变为 13 + 它的敏捷调整值。当目标穿上护甲时，此法术将提前终止。

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.description:
You unleash a blast of cold air. Each creature in a 60-foot Cone originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

materials.value: a small crystal or glass cone

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmRam00000000000]] attack, one [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attack, and one [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attack. It can replace the Claw attack with a use of [[/item .mmFireBreath0000]] if available.

Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], or [[/damage average activity=HN2sfAtHqDMjMLXF]] damage if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] had Advantage on the attack roll.

Ram.name: Ram
Ram.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Dalelands) Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

Explore the magic of Myth Drannor.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifTempleOfTrans]{Temple Of Transmutation}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.RorPsvnfU5JyX1Lw]{The Temple of Transmutation}

Situation. Letha Salen, a Shadovar survivor of the crash of Thultanthar, has entered the Temple of Transmutation, an ancient magical research institute in Myth Drannor. Using a transmutation chamber in the temple, she’s transforming people and animals into monsters under her command.

Hook. Monster attacks on the edge of Cormanthor suddenly increase. Foresters report the creatures are coming from a large ruin just inside the walls of Myth Drannor. The leader of the local dale, or perhaps the Dales Council, asks the characters to find out what’s going on and stop the monster attacks.

Encounters

The party travels to Myth Drannor. Once the characters reach the site, use the map on the facing page for the Temple of Transmutation. Other levels of the temple are blocked by rubble.

In their exploration, the characters meet Humanoids and Beasts that have been shape-shifted into various creatures. A character who succeeds on a [[/skill 15 skill=nat/ins]] check recognizes a shape-shifted creature as a former Humanoid or Beast, respectively. When any of these transformed creatures die, the shape-shifting effect ends, and they return to their true forms. If transformed back to their original shapes while still alive, Letha’s minions are @UUID[Actor.aifGuard00000000]{Guard}s and Letha is a @UUID[Actor.aifMage000000000]{Mage}.

This adventure includes the encounters on the following pages.

Transformed Creatures

All Tokens in the Scene have been placed as their "true" form and then transformed into their changed form. To revert them to their original form:

  1. Open their character sheet by double clicking on their Token.

  2. Click on the kebab menu ( ) in the top-right of their sheet.

  3. Click on the  Restore Transformation option.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.Kn9FqbEN5zGpIQ84 caption=false]

Baxton Cottage.name: Baxton Cottage
Baxton Cottage.text: A rustic cottage is under attack by a @UUID[Actor.aifChuul00000000]{Chuul}, an @UUID[Actor.aifEttin00000000]{Ettin}, a @UUID[Actor.aifFlameskull000]{Flameskull}, and a @UUID[Actor.aifHelmedHorror0]{Helmed Horror}, minions of Letha Salen who have been shape-shifted. A halfling named Beauregard Baxton is trapped inside with his four family members (Small, Neutral Good @UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoners}). When one of the creatures is defeated, the rest flee, returning to area 9 to tell Letha about the party. Once rescued, Beauregard welcomes the party into his home. He has lived peacefully in the shadow of the temple for decades, but recently strange monsters have emerged from it and kidnapped his brother Brandon. The party can use his home as a place to rest as they investigate.

Crossroads.name: Crossroads
Crossroads.text: A goat shape-shifted into a @UUID[Actor.aifTyrannosaurus]{Tyrannosaurus Rex} grazes peacefully. If threatened, it flees.

Lookout.name: Lookout
Lookout.text: Two minions of Letha Salen, now transformed into a @UUID[Actor.aifTroll00000000]{Troll} and an @UUID[Actor.aifUmberHulk0000]{Umber Hulk}, keep watch from this hilltop building, looking for potential victims to be transformed.

Crash Wreckage.name: Crash Wreckage
Crash Wreckage.text: Pieces of Thultanthar fell on the temple here, crushing many inhabitants. When the party draws close, six of the corpses animate as @UUID[Actor.aifWight00000000]{Wights}. Once awoken, the wights fight any living creatures they see.

Hideout.name: Hideout
Hideout.text: Beauregard Baxton’s brother Brandon has been transformed into a @UUID[Actor.aifYeti000000000]{Yeti}. He escaped and hid here, unsure what to do. He pretends to be a fierce creature if discovered but responds positively if the characters try to talk to him. Brandon doesn’t remember much from before his transformation, but he’s eager to find his family and protect them.

Ruins.name: Ruins
Ruins.text: A human forester named Wila Peat was captured by Letha and turned into a @UUID[Actor.mmCyclopsSentry0]{Cyclops Sentry}. Letha told Wila to go find more subjects for transmutation, and Wila agreed out of fear. Wila is Indifferent to the characters. As an &Reference[Influence] action, a creature can try to convince her to turn against Letha and make a [[/skill 15 per]] check, earning Wila’s support on a successful check. A character who promises to turn Wila back into a human has Advantage on this check.

Guard Room.name: Guard Room
Guard Room.text: Three of Letha’s followers, now transformed into a @UUID[Actor.aifChimera000000]{Chimera}, a @UUID[Actor.aifDrider0000000]{Drider}, and a @UUID[Actor.aifMedusa0000000]{Medusa} respectively, guard the temple and await Letha’s orders.

Transmutation Chamber.name: Transmutation Chamber
Transmutation Chamber.text:
Once a day, a character outside the transmutation chamber can take the &Reference[Magic] action to activate it and shape-shift a Humanoid or Beast inside the chamber into a creature of another type. (On the day the party arrives, the chamber hasn’t been used.) The new form is chosen by the DM. The target’s game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen creature, but the target retains its alignment and personality.

The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the anatomy of its new form; if the new form can’t speak, for example, the target can’t speak either and can’t use Verbal components.

When the target shape-shifts, its equipment drops to the ground.

Casting the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse} spell on a creature shape-shifted this way restores it to its original form. The effect also ends if the creature dies. Once a creature has been affected by the transmutation chamber, the chamber doesn’t work on it again.

Letha's Lair.name: Letha's Lair
Letha's Lair.text: Letha has transformed herself into a @UUID[Actor.aifYoungBlueDrag]{Young Blue Dragon}. If she’s not using the transmutation chamber on another victim, she’s here, trying to figure out how to better control the chamber or plotting her takeover of the Dalelands.

Fey Annex.name: Fey Annex
Fey Annex.text: Only Fey creatures can pass through the archway entrance to this part of the temple. A @UUID[Actor.aifDireWorg00000]{Dire Worg}, preserved in magical suspended animation since the glory days of Myth Drannor, sleeps in the chamber. It awakens if touched or if it takes damage.

The Dallabad Curse.name: The Dallabad Curse
The Dallabad Curse.description:
A Location (Calimshan) Adventure for

Level 5 Characters

Drive off the ghost that haunts an oasis.

Situation. A mind flayer named Yharaskrik has survived a sojourn on the Astral Plane and returned to the Dallabad Oasis, not far from Calimport.

Hook. Caravans have used Dallabad safely for decades. But in recent months, anyone stopping there has been attacked by Undead and other strange creatures. A Kochar council hires the characters to make Dallabad Oasis safe again.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithD]{Speak with Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn’t return the creature’s soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can’t learn new information, doesn’t comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can’t speculate about future events.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to the Stench of all [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 hour.
