Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .l4INK64V3wIju2AS]] attacks.

Blinding Flash.name: Blinding Flash
Blinding Flash.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Onad9uNiCzAMfuwf]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Onad9uNiCzAMfuwf]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=Onad9uNiCzAMfuwf]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the start of the user’s next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description: You ward a creature within range. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Baldur's Gate) Adventure for

Level 9 Characters

Conspire against the followers of Bane.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifTheUnrollingS]{The Unrolling Scroll}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.lP2kUG8O8W6JBJBZ]{The Shadow Parliament}

Situation. Followers of Bane infiltrated the Parliament of Peers as a “Shadow Parliament,” eager to convince the rest of the parliament to seize additional authority over trade, defense, and taxation. The Council of Four can’t formally stop this legally proper procedure, but the council insists that debates on it be held publicly at the Unrolling Scroll. Banites work to eliminate politicians opposed to the power grab, including the human philanthropist Roxus Nalbeth (Medium, Lawful Good @UUID[Actor.aifNoble00000000]{Noble}).

Hook. Allies who fear their authority being undermined, such as a commoner crew, arrange for the characters to help Roxus Nalbeth at the debates.

Encounters

The debate takes place at the Unrolling Scroll (see “Upper City”); you can use its map for this adventure.

Ambush. On the way to the Unrolling Scroll, the characters are ambushed by a @UUID[Actor.aifCultistofBane]{Cultist of Bane} (see chapter 9) and two @UUID[Actor.aifWarriorVetera]{Warrior Veterans} dressed as Flaming Fist members. They level a spurious accusation of criminal activity as a pretext to attack. If the characters search the cultist, they find a tattoo of Bane’s symbol on him.

Debate Preparation. The characters meet Roxus in a reserved room at the Unrolling Scroll. He shares rumors that a secret, tyrannical “Shadow Parliament” is gaining followers within the Parliament of Peers, and this debate is the last chance to keep the Shadow Parliament from seizing control. If the characters share they were ambushed by followers of Bane, Roxus surmises that cultists of Bane are probably behind the clandestine organization.

Opening Remarks. The entire Parliament of Peers is in attendance around the reflecting pool for the debate’s opening remarks, as are the members of the Council of Four. Roxus’s remarks on the important distinctions between leadership and tyranny stir the crowd. Three @UUID[Actor.aifWaterElementa]{Water Elementals} erupt from the pool to cause mayhem; when they turn to Roxus, the characters are the only ones who can intervene and save him. Characters with a [[/skill perception 14 passive format=long]] spot a dwarf (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifCultistFanati]{Cultist Fanatic}) in the crowd subtly directing the summoned elementals and might notice that she bears the same tattoo as the earlier cultist.

The Debate. Roxus is shaken by the attack, and he asks the characters to take his place. (If Roxus didn’t survive, another parliament member or a commoner crew ally asks the characters to fill this role). There are three debate rounds against patriars who support the power grab, listed below. Only one character can participate in each round, but different characters can participate in ensuing rounds. Victory in a round requires a successful [[/check Deception Persuasion 18 format=long]], but a participating character who succeeds on one of the additional checks listed with each patriar below makes the Charisma check with Advantage. Intersperse the debate checks with reactions from the audience, such as gasps as the characters reveal secrets and applause if they win a round.

Arvin Dlusker. A successful [[/check History Insight 15 format=long]] reveals that Arvin’s debate position is motivated by desire to reverse his family’s severe financial losses.

Brevek Faenor. Duke Brevek Faenor’s arguments in favor of expanding Parliament authority draw surprised gasps from the audience. A successful [[/check History Religion 15 format=long]] reminds the character of Brevek’s tense history as a former priest of Oghma here in the Unrolling Scroll.

Tallis Whitburn. A successful [[/check Nature Perception 15 format=long]] notes slate dust on Tallis’s garments, showing she has resorted to helping with manual labor at her understaffed Whitburn quarry.

The Vote. If the characters win at least two debate rounds, the measure to expand the Parliament of Peers’ authority is voted down. Otherwise, it passes, and the Council of Four summarily approves it.

Treachery at the Bindery. Regardless of the vote’s result, Roxus (or his valet if Roxus died) informs the characters that Arvin Dlusker and Tallis Whitburn have surreptitiously entered the Unrolling Scroll’s bookbindery. There, the characters find both patriars (@UUID[Actor.aifNoble00000000]{Nobles}) talking with two @UUID[Actor.aifBanditDeceive]{Bandit Deceivers}. The politicians are asking about their next orders now that the vote has been decided; the bandits are tattooed cultists of Bane who are orchestrating the Shadow Parliament. The bandits fight to silence the characters, but the patriars retreat. In addition to the four conspirators, two @UUID[Actor.aifPriestAcolyte]{Priest Acolytes} of Oghma work here. The acolytes have the Charmed condition and treat the bandits favorably, but they don’t join the fight.

Conclusion. After the bookbindery battle, the patriars are unwilling to talk about the Shadow Parliament. The two acolytes, however, tell everything they overheard if the characters remove the Charmed condition from them. Their public testimony disgraces Arvin and Tallis and drives the Shadow Parliament back underground—for now.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.bEUoTaiTT4fbBT4s caption=false]

The Weeping Goddess.name: The Weeping Goddess
The Weeping Goddess.description:
A Deity (Shar) Adventure for

Level 2 Characters

Discover a hidden shrine to Shar.

Situation. During a recent new moon, fisherfolk in Leilon heard sobbing on Idol Island, and Valdi Estapaar, the local fishery boss, took a small group there. She discovered a weeping statue alongside a shrine. Mist then covered the isle, and Valdi and her helpers retreated. Since then, grieving people in Leilon have forgotten much of their past while also becoming darker of mood.

Hook. Merrygold Brightshine, priest of Leilon’s Lathander shrine, suspects Shar’s involvement. Merrygold and Valdi ask the characters to investigate the weeping statue. Valdi provides a Rowboat (see the Player’s Handbook), and Merrygold provides four Potions of Healing.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Lacedon Ghoul.description:
Ghouls

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmIcyBite0000000]] attacks.

Icy Bite.name: Icy Bite
Icy Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target’s Speed decreases by 5 feet until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Speed: -5 ft..name: Speed: -5 ft.
Speed: -5 ft..description: The target’s Speed decreases by 5 feet until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=fDMRlni8W3d3QoOD]] [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=fDMRlni8W3d3QoOD]], it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=fDMRlni8W3d3QoOD]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Watery Rush.name: Watery Rush
Watery Rush.description: While underwater, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @activation.condition activity=xoYfePV5epjJkYHX]] without provoking &Reference[Opportunity Attacks].

Expend Use.name: Expend Use
Expend Use.condition: moves up to half its Swim Speed

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .hRwqUlEyM9TjOmHy]] or [[/item .mmRadiantFlame00]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritGuar]{Spirit Guardians}

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Deity (Shar) Adventure for

Level 2 Characters

Discover a hidden shrine to Shar.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifShrineOfLatha]{Shrine Of Lathander}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.nahoqN4H77YzsphI]{The Weeping Goddess}

Situation. During a recent new moon, fisherfolk in Leilon heard sobbing on Idol Island, and Valdi Estapaar, the local fishery boss, took a small group there. She discovered a weeping statue alongside a shrine. Mist then covered the isle, and Valdi and her helpers retreated. Since then, grieving people in Leilon have forgotten much of their past while also becoming darker of mood.

Hook. Merrygold Brightshine, priest of Leilon’s Lathander shrine, suspects Shar’s involvement. Merrygold and Valdi ask the characters to investigate the weeping statue. Valdi provides a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.phbmobRowboat000]{Rowboat} (see the Player’s Handbook), and Merrygold provides four @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPotionofHea]{Potions of Healing}.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Raven Run. As characters leave for Idol Island, they are followed by a large flock of ravens, animals sacred to Shar. Eventually, the birds swoop down and initiate combat. They include three @UUID[Actor.aifSwarmOfRavens]{Swarms of Ravens} and a fourth group infused with shadow magic (@UUID[Actor.aifSwarmOfStirge]{Swarm of Stirges}).

Gloom Mist. Mist around Idol Island dampens nonmagical lights and cantrips so they create only &Reference[Dim Light]. Five sobbing @UUID[Actor.aifShadow0000000]{Shadows} ambush the characters as the group nears the shore.

Weeping Goddess. As the party approaches a rough statue fronting an old shrine, sounds of weeping emanate from it. If the group lingers, the crying ceases, and three @UUID[Actor.aifKenku00000000]{Kenku} and a @UUID[Actor.aifCultistFanati]{Cultist Fanatic} loyal to Shar, who were making the weeping noises, emerge from the shrine and order the characters to leave or die.

Entryways. This area has two entrances to the sanctum. A hole opens in the shrine’s southern wall, leading to a flooded tunnel. The shrine’s altar conceals a standard secret door ([[/skill perception 15]] to detect), leading to a dry secret passage.

Flooded Tunnel. Darkness and cloudy water fill this tunnel. Two @UUID[Actor.aifLacedonGhoul0]{Lacedon Ghouls} have been attracted to the deathly magic here.

Sanctum. Within this sanctuary, which also serves as a barrack, an obsidian pillar glows with violet light. Irric (Medium, Neutral Evil @UUID[Actor.aifPriest0000000]{Priest}) dwells here along with three @UUID[Actor.aifKenku00000000]{Kenku}. Irric uses the pillar to draw sorrow from townsfolk to offer to Shar, hoping she’ll break the curse on his kenku followers. During battle, stolen grief manifests as a weeping @UUID[Actor.aifShadow0000000]{Shadow}.

Conclusion. On Irric’s defeat, Shar withdraws her power from the pillar, which returns to normal but blackened stone. The shadows and gloomy mist on Idol Island vanish, as do the unnaturally aggressive ravens. Townsfolk return to normal, and Merrygold and Valdi are grateful.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.98UdhSjeUGwJYWmk caption=false]

The Tomb of Damara.name: The Tomb of Damara
The Tomb of Damara.description:
A Location (Dalelands) Adventure for

Level 3 Characters

Recover an artifact from an undead ogre.

Situation. The spirit of the ogre warlord Bonegnasher grows restless and seeks Damara’s fabled orb.

Hook. Lady Khara Sulwood calls the characters to Shadowdale Town and asks them to enter the Tomb of Damara and destroy Bonegnasher, who has returned from death. Bonegnasher has captured a Dalefolk family, the Silverstars, but Sulwood doesn’t know why. Sulwood offers to pay each character 100 GP and suggests the tomb might have other plunder.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item .mmParalyzingTent]] and makes one [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Paralyzing Tentacles.name: Paralyzing Tentacles
Paralyzing Tentacles.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]], it succeeds automatically. While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Poisoned & Paralyzed.name: Poisoned & Paralyzed
Poisoned & Paralyzed.description:
The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Ooze Cube.name: Ooze Cube
Ooze Cube.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] fills its entire space and is transparent. Other creatures can enter that space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Engulf and has Disadvantage on the saving throw.

Creatures inside the [[lookup @name lowercase]] have &Reference[Total Cover], and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can hold one Large creature or up to four Medium or Small creatures inside itself at a time.

As an action, a creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=EcTOfXWsDJRHLydy]] [[lookup @range.units activity=EcTOfXWsDJRHLydy]]. of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can pull a creature or an object out of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] by succeeding on a [[/check dc=12 ability=str skill=ath format=long]], and the puller takes [[/damage average activity=PMCvyqxfUYiPzNK8]] damage.

Total Cover.name: Total Cover
Total Cover.description: Creatures inside the attacking creature have Total Cover.

Transparent.name: Transparent
Transparent.description: Even when the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is in plain sight, a creature must succeed on a [[/check dc=15 ability=wis skill=prc format=long]] to notice the [[lookup @name lowercase]] if the creature hasn’t witnessed the [[lookup @name lowercase]] move or otherwise act.

Engulf.name: Engulf
Engulf.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures if it has room inside itself to contain them (see the @UUID[.mmOozeCube000000] trait).

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=5o0Bh8PQaojx5XMx]], each creature whose space the [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters for the first time during this move.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is engulfed. An engulfed target is &Reference[suffocating], can’t cast spells with a Verbal component, has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition, and takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns. When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves, the engulfed target moves with it. An engulfed target can try to escape by taking an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@abilities.str.dc]] check. On a successful check, the target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space.

Success: Half damage, and the target moves to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s. If there is no unoccupied space, the target fails the save instead.

Total Cover, Suffocating & Restrained.name: Total Cover, Suffocating & Restrained
Total Cover, Suffocating & Restrained.description: An engulfed target is &Reference[suffocating], can’t cast spells with a Verbal component, has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition, and takes [[/damage average 3d6 type=acid]] damage at the start of each of the user's turns.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The mummy makes two [[/item .mmRottingFist000]] attacks and uses [[/item .mmDreadfulGlare0]].

Rotting Fist.name: Rotting Fist
Rotting Fist.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can't regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can’t regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Dreadful Glare.name: Dreadful Glare
Dreadful Glare.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Dreadful Glare for 24 hours.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Sunlight Weakness.name: Sunlight Weakness
Sunlight Weakness.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on D20 Tests.

Draining Swipe.name: Draining Swipe
Draining Swipe.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target's Strength score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0. If a Humanoid is slain by this attack, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.aifShadow0000000]{Shadow} rises from the corpse [[/r 1d4]] hours later.

Foundry Note

This feature also provides an Active Effect (AE) to modify the target's Strength Score. When the target roll's their d4 to determine the loss, you can apply the respective AE to the target's sheet.

attack.chatFlavor: On Hit: Target's STR score decreases

Shadow Stealth.name: Shadow Stealth
Shadow Stealth.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Hide] action.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Standing Leap.name: Standing Leap
Standing Leap.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Long Jump is up to 20 feet and its High Jump is up to 10 feet with or without a running start.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]).

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: If the target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC).

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] swallows a [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=IPD9mDjKJEXc2uMQ]] target it is grappling. While swallowed, the target isn’t Grappled but has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, and it has &Reference[Total Cover] against attacks and other effects outside the frog.

While swallowing the target, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t use Bite, and if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, the swallowed target is no longer Restrained and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting with the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

At the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn, the swallowed target takes [[/damage 2d4 acid average]] damage. If that damage doesn’t kill it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] disgorges it, causing it to exit &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover.name: Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover
Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover.description: While swallowed, a creature has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, has &Reference[Total Cover apply=false] against attacks.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If you are regurgitated, you fall into a space within 10 ft. and are &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Dalelands) Adventure for

Level 3 Characters

Recover an artifact from an undead ogre.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifTombOfDamara0]{Tomb Of Damara}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.qZ1xbp8JuXdPmwr9]{The Tomb of Damara}

Situation. The spirit of the ogre warlord Bonegnasher grows restless and seeks Damara’s fabled orb.

Hook. Lady Khara Sulwood calls the characters to Shadowdale Town and asks them to enter the Tomb of Damara and destroy Bonegnasher, who has returned from death. Bonegnasher has captured a Dalefolk family, the Silverstars, but Sulwood doesn’t know why. Sulwood offers to pay each character [[/award 100GP]] and suggests the tomb might have other plunder.

Encounters

Bonegnasher dwells in a ruined castle with subterranean tunnels. Use the @UUID[Scene.aifTombOfDamara0]{map} on this page, with the characters entering via the area labeled “Start.” The following encounters happen in the corresponding areas.

Barrack and Great Hall. Two @UUID[Actor.aifGhoul00000000]{Ghouls} dwell in the barrack. If creatures enter the barrack or make loud noises in the great hall, the monsters pounce.

Prison. The four members of the Silverstar family (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoners}) are being kept prisoner here in the corner cell. A @UUID[Actor.aifHobgoblinCapt]{Hobgoblin Captain} and two @UUID[Actor.aifHobgoblinWarr]{Hobgoblin Warriors} are interrogating the family. The hobgoblins are Hostile to anyone other than Bonegnasher who interrupts their work. The youngest Silverstar, Sara, is hiding the key to Damara’s tomb. Once rescued, Sara gratefully gives the key to her rescuers.

Garden. An Indifferent @UUID[Actor.aifGiantFrog0000]{Giant Frog} lives here.

Storeroom. Six @UUID[Actor.aifGiantRat00000]{Giant Rats} lurk among the splintered crates and ambush anyone who approaches. As a &Reference[Study] action, a creature can make a [[/skill 10 inv]] check to look for useful supplies, finding a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagPotionofHea]{Potion of Healing} and five days’ worth of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagRations0000]{Rations} on a successful check.

Bonegnasher’s Den. Bonegnasher (use the @UUID[Actor.aifSpecter000000]{Specter} stat block, but Bonegnasher is Large) takes a break from interrogating the Silverstars here with his two pet @UUID[Actor.aifWolf000000000]{Wolves}. He is Hostile toward any unfamiliar creature that enters his room.

Vault. The vault contains [[/award 200GP]].

Armory. A @UUID[Actor.aifCarrionCrawle]{Carrion Crawler} lurks on the ceiling. Inside the armory is a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifLongsword1000]{+1 Longsword} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifShield0000000]{+1 Shield}.

Mine. A @UUID[Actor.aifGelatinousCub]{Gelatinous Cube} roams the cavern.

Damara’s Tomb. The magic door to this hidden chamber can be opened only with the key kept by Sara Silverstar. Damara is now a @UUID[Actor.aifMummy00000000]{Mummy} protected by two @UUID[Actor.aifShadow0000000]{Shadows}. In addition to the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifOrbOfDamara00]{Orb of Damara}, the tomb contains a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifSpellScrollFi]{Spell Scroll of Fireball}, and [[/award 500GP]].

Conclusion. Lady Sulwood pays the characters as promised on the defeat of Bonegnasher. She says the party can keep any treasure they found while exploring the tomb; if the characters have the Orb of Damara, she recoils at its presence, citing its ominous history and suggesting that the characters find a way to destroy the relic.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.LGino0JW51skPN03 caption=false]

Wreck of the Silverhand.name: Wreck of the Silverhand
Wreck of the Silverhand.description:
A Location (Moonshae Isles) Adventure for

Level 6 Characters

Recover a famous treasure from a sunken ship.

Situation. A Ffolk trading vessel carrying mysterious cargo has gone down in the Sea of Moonshae. The wreck lies in shallow water; some of its masts poke above the waves.

Hook. Jarl Olfsvenn of Norland enlists the characters to explore the wreck and retrieve the contents of its safe. He’s learned from his sister Queen Forfallen that the safe contains the lost ring of Cymrych Hugh; he intends to secure the ring and give it to High King Kendrick for safekeeping. Alternatively, the characters might spot the wreck while traveling.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack

rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg.name: Slow
rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot Cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's Speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't take Reactions. On its turns, it can take either an action or a Bonus Action, not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. If it casts a spell with a Somatic component, there is a [[/r 1d100cs<=25#Slowed spell cast success]]{25 percent} chance the spell fails as a result of the target making the spell's gestures too slowly.

An affected target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Foundry Note

The inline roll above will return 1 if it succeeded or 0 if it failed.

Slowed.name: Slowed
Slowed.description:
An affected target’s Speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can’t take Reactions. If it casts a spell with a Somatic component, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>25#Slowed spell cast success]]{25 percent} chance the spell fails as a result of the target making the spell’s gestures too slowly.

An affected target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplElementali]{Elementalism}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplControlWat]{Control Water}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCreateorDe]{Create or Destroy Water}

Elementalism.name: Elementalism
Elementalism.description:
You exert control over the elements, creating one of the following effects within range.

Beckon Air. You create a breeze strong enough to ripple cloth, stir dust, rustle leaves, and close open doors and shutters, all in a 5-foot Cube. Doors and shutters being held open by someone or something aren’t affected.

Beckon Earth. You create a thin shroud of dust or sand that covers surfaces in a 5-foot-square area, or you cause a single word to appear in your handwriting in a patch of dirt or sand.

Beckon Fire. You create a thin cloud of harmless embers and colored, scented smoke in a 5-foot Cube. You choose the color and scent, and the embers can light candles, torches, or lamps in that area. The smoke’s scent lingers for 1 minute.

Beckon Water. You create a spray of cool mist that lightly dampens creatures and objects in a 5-foot Cube. Alternatively, you create 1 cup of clean water either in an open container or on a surface, and the water evaporates in 1 minute.

Sculpt Element. You cause dirt, sand, fire, smoke, mist, or water that can fit in a 1-foot Cube to assume a crude shape (such as that of a creature) for 1 hour.

Beckon Element.name: Beckon Element
Beckon Element.chatFlavor: Fire and water beckoning lasts for 1 minute

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn’t being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Control Water.name: Control Water
Control Water.description:
Until the spell ends, you control any water inside an area you choose that is a Cube up to 100 feet on a side, using one of the following effects. As a Magic action on your later turns, you can repeat the same effect or choose a different one.

Flood. You cause the water level of all standing water in the area to rise by as much as 20 feet. If you choose an area in a large body of water, you instead create a 20-foot tall wave that travels from one side of the area to the other and then crashes. Any Huge or smaller vehicles in the wave’s path are carried with it to the other side. Any Huge or smaller vehicles struck by the wave have a [[/r 1d100cs<26#Vehicle is capsized]]{25 percent} chance of capsizing.

The water level remains elevated until the spell ends or you choose a different effect. If this effect produced a wave, the wave repeats on the start of your next turn while the flood effect lasts.

Part Water. You part water in the area and create a trench. The trench extends across the spell’s area, and the separated water forms a wall to either side. The trench remains until the spell ends or you choose a different effect. The water then slowly fills in the trench over the course of the next round until the normal water level is restored.

Redirect Flow. You cause flowing water in the area to move in a direction you choose, even if the water has to flow over obstacles, up walls, or in other unlikely directions. The water in the area moves as you direct it, but once it moves beyond the spell’s area, it resumes its flow based on the terrain. The water continues to move in the direction you chose until the spell ends or you choose a different effect.

Whirlpool. You cause a whirlpool to form in the center of the area, which must be at least 50 feet square and 25 feet deep. The whirlpool lasts until you choose a different effect or the spell ends. The whirlpool is 5 feet wide at the base, up to 50 feet wide at the top, and 25 feet tall. Any creature in the water and within 25 feet of the whirlpool is pulled 10 feet toward it. When a creature enters the whirlpool for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, it makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 Bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. A creature can swim away from the whirlpool only if it first takes an action to pull away and succeeds on a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

materials.value: a mixture of water and dust

Create or Destroy Water.name: Create or Destroy Water
Create or Destroy Water.description:
You do one of the following:

Create Water. You create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, the water falls as rain in a 30-foot Cube within range, extinguishing exposed flames there.

Destroy Water. You destroy up to 10 gallons of water in an open container within range. Alternatively, you destroy fog in a 30-foot Cube within range.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You create or destroy 10 additional gallons of water, or the size of the Cube increases by 5 feet, for each spell slot level above 1.

materials.value: a mix of water and sand

Response—Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=nCfH0YgOhJR2wIKd]], the triggering enemy.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed up to 30 feet straight away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] by conjured water.

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.aifZombie0000000]{Zombie} under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at a time.

Cymrych Hugh's Ring.name: Cymrych Hugh's Ring
Cymrych Hugh's Ring.description: The lost ring of Cymrych Hugh found in the wreck of the Silverhand.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Moonshae Isles) Adventure for

Level 6 Characters

Recover a famous treasure from a sunken ship.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifWreckOfTheSil]{Wreck of the Silverhand}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.wdh8RPSDaVdw0zyt]{Wreck of the Silverhand}

Situation. A Ffolk trading vessel carrying mysterious cargo has gone down in the Sea of Moonshae. The wreck lies in shallow water; some of its masts poke above the waves.

Hook. Jarl Olfsvenn of Norland enlists the characters to explore the wreck and retrieve the contents of its safe. He’s learned from his sister Queen Forfallen that the safe contains the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifCymrychHughsR]{lost ring of Cymrych Hugh}; he intends to secure the ring and give it to High King Kendrick for safekeeping. Alternatively, the characters might spot the wreck while traveling.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

The Wreck. Use the @UUID[Scene.aifWreckOfTheSil]{ship} map in the Dungeon Master’s Guide. The ship sank when a @UUID[Actor.aifStoneGolem000]{Stone Golem} in the cargo hold broke through the port side.

The Approach. A @UUID[Actor.aifGiantShark000]{Giant Shark} hunts in the wreck.

Main Deck. When characters investigate, the corpses of sailors animate as six @UUID[Actor.aifLacedonGhoul0]{Lacedon Ghouls}.

Foredeck. A @UUID[Actor.aifMerfolkWavebe]{Merfolk Wavebender} hides here, an exile from their people. The merfolk is Indifferent to the party but becomes Friendly if a character takes an Influence action and succeeds on a [[/skill 15 per]] check.

Cargo Hold. This hold contains five crates of an alchemical substance. Every crate is sealed and labeled with a bright-red warning. If a crate takes Fire or Radiant damage, the crate explodes. Creatures in a 15-foot-radius Sphere centered on the crate make a [[/save 15 dex]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 6d6 Fire]] damage or half as much damage on a successful one. This might cause a cascading explosion of nearby crates.

Aft. The ship’s aft is patrolled by five @UUID[Actor.aifWight00000000]{Wights}, all that remains of the captain and their mates. The safe is in the aft cabin belowdecks. The @UUID[Actor.aifSafe000000000]{safe} has AC 20, HP 20, and a Damage Threshold of 20. The safe door’s lock is Complex (1 minute to pick) and of Good quality ([[/tool 15 thief]]). If the characters can open it, they find the ring.

Return of the Golem. When the characters open the safe and attempt to leave with its contents, the @UUID[Actor.aifStoneGolem000]{Stone Golem} returns in the aft cabin.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.w8wbxlHmPFtb9XzZ caption=false]

Well of Lies.name: Well of Lies
Well of Lies.description:
A Deity (Mystra) Adventure for

Level 6 Characters

Explore an ancient wizard tower.

Situation. The Spellplague caused a ruined tower near Secomber, once used for the initiation of wizards, to invert. Now cultists devoted to Cyric have settled there, bringing monsters and evil magic. A ranger of the Order of the Shooting Star (see Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerûn) named Keadan Rolamin investigated, but the cult has slain him.

Hooks. Uvdi Sarsk, a Mystran priest, contacts the characters and asks them to meet her at the Seven-Stringed Harp, a famous tavern in Secomber. Keadan warned her about the inverted tower and told her its location, but she hasn’t heard from him since. She wants the party to investigate.

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn’t return the creature’s soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can’t learn new information, doesn’t comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can’t speculate about future events.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to the Stench of all [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 hour.

z817Et9IPt6qHawH.name: Spiritual Weapon
z817Et9IPt6qHawH.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Tough Boss.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmChainMail0]{Chain Mail}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepHeavyCross]{Heavy Crossbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepWarhammer0]{Warhammer}

Warhammer.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] pushes the target up to 10 feet straight away from itself.

Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Wand.name: Wand
Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmArcaneBurst000]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConeofCold]{Cone of Cold}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

BtkwckQJktc8hRh0.name: Misty Step
BtkwckQJktc8hRh0.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Protective Magic.name: Protective Magic
Protective Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield} in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: when you see a creature within range casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: 你触碰一个未着装护甲的自愿生物。直至法术终止前，目标的基础AC变为 13 + 它的敏捷调整值。当目标穿上护甲时，此法术将提前终止。

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.description:
You unleash a blast of cold air. Each creature in a 60-foot Cone originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

materials.value: a small crystal or glass cone

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Confer Fire Resistance.name: Confer Fire Resistance
Confer Fire Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can grant Resistance to Fire damage to a rider while it is on the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Resistance: Fire.name: Resistance: Fire
Resistance: Fire.description: The creature can grant Resistance to Fire damage to a rider while it is on the creature.

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet.

Ethereal Stride.name: Ethereal Stride
Ethereal Stride.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] and up to [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=0EfvhIXAIPlYUiNE]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=0EfvhIXAIPlYUiNE]] [[lookup @range.units activity=0EfvhIXAIPlYUiNE]]. of it teleport to the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane or vice versa.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Deity (Mystra) Adventure for

Level 6 Characters

Explore an ancient wizard tower.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifInvertedTower]{Inverted Tower}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.x8BZBze50wSjI3T5]{Well of Lies}

Situation. The Spellplague caused a ruined tower near Secomber, once used for the initiation of wizards, to invert. Now cultists devoted to Cyric have settled there, bringing monsters and evil magic. A ranger of the Order of the Shooting Star (see Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerûn) named Keadan Rolamin investigated, but the cult has slain him.

Hooks. Uvdi Sarsk, a Mystran priest, contacts the characters and asks them to meet her at the Seven-Stringed Harp, a famous tavern in Secomber. Keadan warned her about the inverted tower and told her its location, but she hasn’t heard from him since. She wants the party to investigate.

Encounters

The characters reach the inverted tower in a few days. The adventure consists of these encounters.

Wild Magic. The inside of the tower is a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.xgLA30rErlkjIPAK#wild-magic-zone]{wild magic zone}. See chapter 3 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide for rules on wild magic zones.

Living Menhirs. Outside the inverted tower, menhirs and rubble swirl in the air, combining into a creature that defends the entrance. Use the @UUID[Actor.aifAirElemental0]{Air Elemental} stat block but change its creature type to Construct. When the creature drops to 0 Hit Points, the last menhir animates (use the @UUID[Actor.aifGalebDuhr0000]{Galeb Duhr} stat block).

Initiation Well. The tower once had a level for each school of magic. Only four levels remain, listed from the top to the bottom:

Transmutation. Open to the sky, the transmutation level has three @UUID[Actor.aifAwakenedTree0]{Awakened Trees} and a @UUID[Actor.aifAnimatedRugOf]{Animated Rug of Smothering}. A Cyric @UUID[Actor.aifBerserker0000]{Berserker} watching the entry joins any combat.

Necromancy. Rough exam tables fill this level. A @UUID[Actor.aifGhastGravecal]{Ghast Gravecaller} and three @UUID[Actor.aifGhoul00000000]{Ghouls} converse with a @UUID[Actor.aifCultistFanati]{Cultist Fanatic}. They study the dead remains of Keadan, his three comrades, and two slain cultists.

Illusion. This level subjects invaders to an illusory maze, but the magic fades as two @UUID[Actor.aifCultistFanati]{Cultist Fanatics}, two @UUID[Actor.aifToughBoss0000]{Tough Bosses}, and four @UUID[Actor.aifCultist000000]{Cultists} use the illusions to surprise interlopers. The area is a barrack stocked with supplies.

Reveal the Room When Ready

This floor starts with a Darkness light source enabled to prevent players who enter it from being able to see the room until you're ready to end the illusory maze portion. You can disable the light to reveal the room.

Conjuration. On this level, a human man named Nacrel (Medium, Chaotic Evil @UUID[Actor.aifMage000000000]{Mage}) works inside a runic circle, experimenting with a floating silvery-blue orb of energy connected to Weave threads. His allied @UUID[Actor.aifNightmare0000]{Nightmare} lurks in the southern tunnel, which leads outside. The orb can be disrupted with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic} spell (DC 17) or by slaying Nacrel. Until the orb fails, Nacrel regains 5 Hit Points at the start of each of his turns, provided he has at least 1 Hit Point remaining.

Conclusion. Uvdi Sarsk rewards each character with an Uncommon magic item.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.94AzIilsAHZu70Ye caption=false]

The Siege of Shalespire Priory.name: The Siege of Shalespire Priory
The Siege of Shalespire Priory.description:
A Faction (Order of the Gauntlet) Adventure for

Level 2 Characters

Defend a temple from bloodthirsty goblins.

Situation. Raiders commanded by the Hobgoblin Captain Lac the Breaker lay siege to the Priory of Shalespire, a place of shelter for travelers and pilgrimage site for the faithful of Lathander.

Hook. The characters are resting at the priory as the raiders are spotted. The monks and clergy won’t survive without the party’s help and desperately ask for aid.

Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. Warded.description:
Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell.

The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.
